actor_awards.notes: Received an Honorary Academy Award in 2013. She holds the record for the most Golden Globe nominations (15) and wins (4) for Best Actress in a Television Drama Series for 'Murder, She Wrote'. She was made a Dame Commander of the Order of the British Empire in 2014.

filmography.title: The Manchurian Candidate
filmography.role_description: The chilling, manipulative mother and handler of a brainwashed assassin, often cited as one of the greatest villains in cinema history.
filmography.plot: An American POW in the Korean War is brainwashed as an assassin for an international Communist conspiracy.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actress; Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: Gaslight
filmography.role_description: A cockney maid who flirtatiously torments her mistress at the behest of the master. Lansbury's film debut.
filmography.plot: Years after her aunt was murdered in her home, a young woman moves back into the house with her new husband, but he has a secret that he will do anything to protect.

filmography.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
filmography.role_description: A sweet, innocent tavern singer who falls in love with the corrupt Dorian Gray.
filmography.plot: A corrupt young man somehow keeps his youthful beauty eternally, but a special painting gradually reveals his inner ugliness to all.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actress; Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: Beauty and the Beast
filmography.role_description: The voice of the kind, motherly teapot who sings the film's title song.
filmography.plot: A prince cursed to spend his days as a hideous monster sets out to regain his humanity by earning a young woman's love.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Song ('Beauty and the Beast', performed by Lansbury in film)

filmography.title: Bedknobs and Broomsticks
filmography.role_description: An apprentice witch who uses her magic to fight Nazis during World War II with the help of three children.
filmography.plot: An apprentice witch, three kids, and a cynical magician search for the missing component to a magic spell to be used in the defense of Britain in World War II.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actress in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy

filmography.title: National Velvet
filmography.role_description: The older sister of Velvet Brown in this classic horse racing drama.
filmography.plot: A jaded former jockey helps a young girl prepare a wild but gifted horse for England's Grand National Sweepstakes.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actress (Anne Revere); National Film Registry: Inducted (2003)

filmography.title: Death on the Nile
filmography.role_description: An eccentric, alcoholic romance novelist who becomes a suspect in a murder on a Nile cruise.
filmography.plot: As Hercule Poirot enjoys a luxurious cruise down the Nile, a newlywed heiress is found murdered on board.

filmography.title: The Court Jester
filmography.role_description: A princess who falls in love with a carnival performer disguised as a jester.
filmography.plot: A hapless carnival performer disguises himself as the court jester as part of a plot against an evil ruler.

filmography.title: The Long, Hot Summer
filmography.role_description: The long-suffering mistress of a wealthy Mississippi patriarch.
filmography.plot: A conman arrives in a Mississippi town and ingratiates himself with a wealthy family, raising the ire of the son and the interest of the daughter.

filmography.title: The Harvey Girls
filmography.role_description: A saloon singer and the rival to Judy Garland's character in a western town.
filmography.plot: A group of mail-order waitresses head west to open a Harvey House restaurant and bring civilization to a rowdy town.

filmography.title: State of the Union
filmography.role_description: A powerful newspaper magnate who manipulates a presidential candidate.
filmography.plot: An industrialist is urged to run for President, but requires the support of his estranged wife to appear as a happy family man.

filmography.title: Samson and Delilah
filmography.role_description: The older sister of Delilah, who becomes the object of Samson's initial affection.
filmography.plot: When strongman Samson rejects the love of the beautiful Delilah, she seeks vengeance that brings down the temple.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Art Direction, Best Costume Design

filmography.title: The Dark at the Top of the Stairs
filmography.role_description: A lonely widow who befriends the husband of the main character.
filmography.plot: A harness salesman and his family face various personal crises in 1920s Oklahoma.

filmography.title: Blue Hawaii
filmography.role_description: The dizzy, Southern belle mother of Elvis Presley's character (despite being only nine years older than him).
filmography.plot: After arriving back in Hawaii from the Army, Chad Gates defies his parents' wishes for him to work at the family business and instead goes to work as a tour guide.

filmography.title: The World of Henry Orient
filmography.role_description: The self-absorbed mother of one of the teenage girls obsessed with a pianist.
filmography.plot: Two teenage girls follow an eccentric pianist around New York City after discovering his true nature.

filmography.title: Something for Everyone
filmography.role_description: A destitute Austrian countess who becomes the target of a manipulative young man.
filmography.plot: A young man insinuates himself into the household of an Austrian Countess, manipulating the family members to suit his own ends.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actress in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy

filmography.title: Anastasia
filmography.role_description: The voice of the grandmother searching for her lost granddaughter, the Grand Duchess Anastasia.
filmography.plot: The last surviving child of the Russian Royal Family joins two con men to reunite with the Dowager Empress, while the undead Rasputin seeks her death.

filmography.title: The Three Musketeers
filmography.role_description: The Queen of France who gives the diamond studs to the Duke of Buckingham.
filmography.plot: D'Artagnan and his musketeer friends fight to protect the King and Queen of France from the schemes of Cardinal Richelieu.

filmography.title: All Fall Down
filmography.role_description: The possessive and neurotic mother of two brothers, played by Warren Beatty and Brandon deWilde.
filmography.plot: A young man idolizes his ne'er-do-well older brother, until the brother's destructive nature tears the family apart.

filmography.title: The Company of Wolves
filmography.role_description: The grandmother who tells dark and cautionary fairy tales to her granddaughter.
filmography.plot: A teenage girl's dreams about wolves and the forest are influenced by her grandmother's ominous stories.

filmography.title: Nanny McPhee
filmography.role_description: The domineering and wealthy aunt who threatens to separate the children if their father doesn't remarry.
filmography.plot: A governess uses magic to rein in the behavior of seven unruly children.

filmography.title: The Mirror Crack'd
filmography.role_description: Agatha Christie's famous elderly sleuth investigating a murder in her village involving a movie star.
filmography.plot: Miss Marple investigates the poisoning of a local woman during a fête at the home of a famous movie star.

filmography.title: The Last Unicorn
filmography.role_description: The voice of the wicked witch who captures the unicorn for her carnival.
filmography.plot: A beautiful unicorn sets out on a journey to find others like her, after learning she may be the last of her kind.

filmography.title: The Reluctant Debutante
filmography.role_description: The ambitious mother trying to navigate her daughter through the London social season.
filmography.plot: A teenage girl visiting her father in London falls for a drummer instead of the eligible bachelor her stepmother has chosen.

filmography.title: Mary Poppins Returns
filmography.role_description: A magical balloon seller in the park; one of Lansbury's final film appearances.
filmography.plot: Decades after her original visit, the magical nanny returns to help the Banks siblings and Michael's children through a difficult time.
